isis.stitle: International® T 444E Diesel Engine - Model Years Late 1997 to 2003 - Crankcase, Crankshaft, Connecting Rods, And Pistons - Connecting Rods, Pistons and Piston Rings - Checking Side Clearance Of Oil Control Ring And Intermediate Compression Ring Groove

svcproc.title: Checking Side Clearance Of Oil Control Ring And Intermediate Compression Ring Groove

figure.caption: Checking Side Clearance Of The Intermediate Ring And Oil Control Ring Grooves

step1.para: Check side clearance of intermediate ring groove as follows:

item.para: Place outer edge of new ring in the immediate ring groove.
Roll ring entirely around piston in its respective groove. Make sure ring is able to move freely in its groove.
Use a feeler gauge to check side clearance of each ring in its respective groove.

step1.para: Check side clearance of oil control ring groove as follows:

item.para: Place outer edge of new ring in oil control ring groove.
Roll ring entirely around piston in its respective groove. Make sure ring is able to move freely in groove.
Use a feeler gauge to check side clearance of oil control ring in its respective groove.
Tight side clearance may indicate carbon build up in the ring groove. Ring should be cleaned.
Excessive side clearance indicates ring groove wear and requires piston replacement.
